title: Markeith Lloyd found guilty of murdering pregnant girlfriend Sade Dixon
text:
A Florida man who shot and killed his pregnant ex-girlfriend, and then went on the run for a month before fatally wounding a police officer as she tried to arrest him was found guilty of the murders of his ex-girlfriend and her unborn baby on Wednesday.

Markeith Lloyd, 44, was convicted on Wednesday of murdering his ex, Sade Dixon, in December 2016.

He told a jury that he shot her in 'self-defense' after she allegedly reached for a gun during an argument over whether or not she should keep their baby.

Markeith Lloyd, 44, was convicted on Wednesday of murdering his ex, Sade Dixon, in December 2016.

Lloyd shot and killed his pregnant ex Sade Dixon (left) then, weeks later, killed Debra Clayton when she tried to arrest him

He claimed he was trying to persuade her not to have an abortion when he shot her.

Lloyd then went on the run and in January 2017, shot and killed police officer Debra Clayton outside a Walmart.

She recognized him and tried to arrest him but the pair exchanged gunfire and she was killed.

After shooting her, he went on the run again and was arrested shortly afterwards at a house where he'd been hiding.

Lloyd was arrested in January 2017 after a manhunt. He is shown during an early court appearance with a bandage over his eye - injuries sustained during his arrest

During the trial, the jury heard that Dixon taunted Lloyd about their unborn baby, saying she would not allow him to see the child when born

He has not yet been put on trial for that killing. Prosecutors expect that trial to go to court next year.

They are asking for the death penalty in both cases.

During the trial, the jury heard that Dixon taunted Lloyd about their unborn baby, saying she would not allow him to see it when it was born.

His attorneys claimed he was upset with her for smoking marijuana and eating meat, despite being pregnant.

He said he did not approve of her eating meat because he does not believe 'in death' and thinks that we are all 'God's creatures', he testified on Monday.

He also however testified that he is not religion.

Lloyd insisted that his ex-girlfriend reached for a different gun and was going to kill him but that police stole it from the scene.

Lloyd is pictured before his crime spree began in 2016. He is expected to be sentenced to death for the murders

'She pulled a gun on me. They done took the gun off the crime scene. They've got to be hiding a gun,' he said.

He also revealed how the pair met on Facebook in 2014, after he got out of prison, and that he asked her what her credit score was when they started speaking.

He said it was because he wanted to raise a family.

Lloyd's attorneys based their defense on the idea that he was a loving would-be parent and that he was desperately trying to get his ex to stop smoking marijuana.

However text messages between the pair indicated that he had also been unfaithful to her and that he had gone to strip clubs.

Lloyd is yet to be tried for the police officer's murder.

Prosecutors are also asking for him to be sentenced to death in that case.

Clayton was praised as a hero when she confronted him outside Walmart after recognizing him.

That trial is not due to begin until next year.
